vwr.project.services.graphics
Class DrawManager

java.lang.Object
  vwr.project.services.graphics.DrawManager

public class DrawManager
extends java.lang.Object

Draw Manager initializes the GL parameters, then it uses lists of sprites, elements, and text things that it draws once a frame, then clears* the lists. You need to send the draw commands to the draw manager every frame you want to draw something. If the thing you want to draw is viewed from the camera's perspective, you need to specify that too. Otherwise it will draw it normally, without the camera's view transformation. You need to tell it the camera's parameters. It also draws a mouse cursor, with no camera transformation. *It doesn't actually clear the list, it just marks the things as not needing to be drawn, and allows them to be re-used with new parameters next frame. It will expand these lists as needed.

Method Detail

setCamera

public void setCamera(float x,
                      float y,
                      float r,
                      float s)
Set the camera parameters.

Parameters:
x - - X position of the camera
y - - Y position of the camera
r - - Rotation of the camera
s - - Scale, or zoom of the camera

render

public void render()
Draws the current contents of the lists, then resets them. It will first perform the camera transformations, then draw the things in the lists that need to be drawn with a camera transformation. Then it draws the rest of the things with a normal ortho perspective. The order of drawing is: cam-transformed sprites, elements and text, then GUI or non-cam-transformed sprites elements and text.

DrawSprite

public void DrawSprite(boolean cam,
                       float x,
                       float y,
                       float r,
                       float s,
                       org.newdawn.slick.opengl.Texture tex,
                       org.newdawn.slick.Color col)
Adds a sprite to the sprite list.

Parameters:
cam - - is this sprite a World sprite or a GUI sprite?
x - - X position of this sprite
y - - Y position of this sprite
r - - Rotation of this sprite
s - - Scale of this sprite
tex - - Texture of this sprite
col - - Color tinting of this sprite

DrawString

public void DrawString(boolean cam,
                       org.newdawn.slick.TrueTypeFont ttf,
                       float x,
                       float y,
                       float size,
                       org.newdawn.slick.Color col,
                       java.lang.StringBuffer text)
Adds text to the text list.

Parameters:
cam - - is this text on the World plane or the GUI plane?
ttf - - Font to use for this text
x - - X position of this text
y - - Y position of this text
size - - Size of this text
col - - Color tinting of this sprite
text - - StringBuffer that contains the string of this text.

                     org.newdawn.slick.Color c1,

                     float y2,
                     org.newdawn.slick.Color c2)
Adds a line element to the elements list.

Parameters:
cam - - is this line a part of the World or GUI?
x1 - - X position of the starting point
y1 - - Y position of the starting point
c1 - - Color of the starting point
x2 - - X position of the end point
y2 - - Y position of the end point
c2 - - Color of the end point

LineNextPoint

public void LineNextPoint(boolean cam,
                          float x,
                          float y,
                          org.newdawn.slick.Color c)
Continues the line started by DrawLine. Connecting it to the end point of the last line.

Parameters:
x - - X position of the next point
y - - Y position of the next point
c - - Color of the next point

s - - Scale of the cursor
tex - - Texture of the cursor
col - - Color tint of the texture of the cursor.
